item.description:
This month's meeting will feature Ross Knights, presenting Thai Yoga Bodywork.

Thai yoga bodywork (aka Thai massage) has its roots in the healing traditions of both India and China, fusing aspects of traditional Chinese medicine, Ayurveda and yoga. Thai yoga bodywork yields results similar to those obtained by modern Western myofascial techniques (Rolfing, structural integration, etc) as well as the effects of energy work (acupuncture/acupressure, Reiki, polarity). Thai yoga bodywork invites the deep release of physical and psycho-emotional tension while invigorating the nervous system, balancing the immune response and restoring body-mind resilience.

The presentation will include a demo.

Ross Knights has five years experience practicing Thai yoga bodywork and teaching power vinyasa yoga, on a foundation of over ten years of study of yoga and assorted martial arts. A certified Thai-Shiatsu bodyworker and register yoga teacher, Ross studied Thai bodywork with Kripalu scholar-in-residence Ken Nelson and with Jonas Westring. He has pursued advanced Thai massage training in Chaig Mai, Thailand. He has also studied mind-body healing modalities at Esalen Institute

Our meetings begin with a potluck lunch and time to get to know everyone in the group a little bit better.
When you RSVP, let us know what you will bring to the potluck.

$10 meetup fee.
